title: Nightingale
data:
| )   Nightingale   *(No tile)*         |                                                                       |
| ------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                             | [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana")                                       |
|                                       |                                                                       |
| Damage vs. small                      | 1d10 **+3** *+(1d5 \* 6) (10% chance)*                                |
| Damage vs. large                      | 1d12 **+3** *+(1d5 \* 6) (10% chance)*                                |
| To-hit bonus                          | +2                                                                    |
| Bonus versus                          | *(any)*                                                               |
|                                       |                                                                       |
| Weapon skill                          | [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")                           |
| Size                                  | one-handed                                                            |
| Affiliation                           | - [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")
- ([Ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja")) |
|                                       |                                                                       |
| When carried                          | *(none)*                                                              |
| When wielded                          | *(none)*                                                              |
| When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") | * toggles [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility")           |
|                                       |                                                                       |
| Base price                            | 2000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                    |
| Weight                                | [40](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                           |
| Material                              | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                                             |

**Nightingale** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). It is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")-aligned, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Average damage calculation](#Average_damage_calculation)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)

## Generation

Nightingale is the guaranteed first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for [Ninjas](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja").

## Description

**Nightingale** deals +3 damage against all monsters, with a 1⁄10 chance of dealing an extra 1d5 \* 6 damage every attack. While the average damage of +6d5 vs +1d5 \* 6 is the same (18), the damage output distribution is conceptually different as you will only get values of 6, 12, 18, 24, and 30.

When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke"), Nightingale toggles [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility").

## Strategy

Although Nightingale's potential for damage is high, the 1⁄10 chance makes its output "spiky" and somewhat unreliable. With that in mind, the average damage is still on par with that of other artifact weapons like [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur"), and the additional to-hit bonus and invisibility toggle can make Nightingale quite the powerful early- or mid-game weapon.

## Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [weapon skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or [demons](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").

| Bonus Damage Proc                                                                                   |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ![\frac{6+12+18+24+30}{5}\*10%=\bold{1.8}](/images/math/7/c/9/7c91d44f54d6d00f90ae54b933b5ba24.png) |

| Weapon         | Small monsters                                                                                 | Large monsters                                                                                 |
| -------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| +0 Nightingale | ![\frac{1+10}{2}+3+1.8=\bold{10.3}](/images/math/7/3/a/73a435d2aa700883a22c43a3b4679b04.png)   | ![\frac{1+12}{2}+3+1.8=\bold{11.3}](/images/math/3/b/4/3b47311c2649d96c937d655dc3404970.png)   |
| +7 Nightingale | ![\frac{1+10}{2}+3+1.8+7=\bold{17.3}](/images/math/e/5/c/e5c879a95a488f67c26c466cc47172d2.png) | ![\frac{1+12}{2}+3+1.8+7=\bold{18.3}](/images/math/c/9/0/c90522c005f35b27de7f7f22acdd8ddd.png) |

## Messages

- The night blade howls as it slices through \<monster>.

  Nightingale's extra damage effect has triggered.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Nightingale is an artifact weapon that appears in SlashTHEM. It is chaotic-aligned, and its base item is a katana.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 Average damage calculation
  • 5 Messages

Generation

Nightingale is the guaranteed first sacrifice gift for Ninjas.

Description

Nightingale deals +3 damage against all monsters, with a 1⁄10 chance of dealing an extra 1d5 * 6 damage every attack. While the average damage of +6d5 vs +1d5 * 6 is the same (18), the damage output distribution is conceptually different as you will only get values of 6, 12, 18, 24, and 30.

When invoked, Nightingale toggles invisibility.

Strategy

Although Nightingale's potential for damage is high, the 1⁄10 chance makes its output "spiky" and somewhat unreliable. With that in mind, the average damage is still on par with that of other artifact weapons like Excalibur, and the additional to-hit bonus and invisibility toggle can make Nightingale quite the powerful early- or mid-game weapon.

Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from weapon skills, strength, or from using a blessed weapon against undead or demons.

Bonus Damage Proc
Weapon Small monsters Large monsters
+0 Nightingale
+7 Nightingale

Messages

The night blade howls as it slices through <monster>.
Nightingale's extra damage effect has triggered.
